page.title: 06Horses and more horses.
page.content: When it was decided to move the National Stud to Newmarket,Sandley was bought by Mr.Simon Wingfield Digby to replace the stud at Sherborne Castle, twelve miles away.Two stallion paddocks have been added and three stallion boxes in their own yard,plus an eight and a fourteen yard. Two grassy hillocks,one on either side of the drive are the spoil heaps from the tunnel repair sixty years ago. At the end of the lawn are inscribed tombstones where Amphion,Big Game and the famous Sun Chariot are buried.At this stud stands Air Trooper. Thirtyfour boxes and about 80 acres are let off as part of the separate concern of Blackmore Vale Stud.Standing here are Martinmas,Kala Shikari and Capricorn Line.
